rdgGrp.n: ['<del>comfort</del> <del> sympathize </del> <del>him i h</del> <del>sympo</del> sympa<zone eid="c57-0069__main"/> <surface eid="ox-ms_abinger_c57-0069"/> <surface lrx="5138" lry="7032" partof="#ox-frankenstein_volume_ii" ulx="0" uly="0" folio="35v" shelfmark="ms. abinger c. 57" base="ox-ms_abinger_c57/ox-ms_abinger_c57-0070.xml" id="ox-ms_abinger_c57-0070" sid="ox-ms_abinger_c57-0070"/> <graphic url="http://shelleygodwinarchive.org/images/ox/ms_abinger_c57/ms_abinger_c57-0070.jp2"/> <zone type="main" sid="c57-0070__main"/> thize with', 'him']
['must not be trifled with: and i demand an answer.']
['must not be trifled with; and i demand an answer.']
['"by the sun, and by the blue sky of heaven, and by the fire of love that burns my heart,']
['by the sun and by the <del>clouds</del> blue sky of heaven', '']

['i took no rest, but returned immediately to geneva. even in my own heart i could give no expression to my sensations—they weighed on me with a mountain’s weight, and their excess destroyed my agony beneath them. thus i returned home, and entering the house, presented myself to the family. my haggard and wild appearance awoke intense alarm; but i answered no question, scarcely did i speak. i felt as if i were placed under a ban—as if i had no right to claim their sympathies—as if never more might i enjoy companionship with them. yet even thus i loved them to adoration; and to save them, i resolved to dedicate myself to my most abhorred task. the prospect of such an occupation made every other circumstance of existence pass']
